intro: Atherosperma micranthum, commonly known as the small-flowered atherosperma, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its compact shrub form with dense, evergreen foliage. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, typically blooming in spring. Its leaves are leathery and arranged in a spiral pattern along the stems. Atherosperma micranthum is adapted to nutrient-poor soils and is often found in fynbos vegetation.
